preqs: Two units in MID2004, MID2006 or MID2105.

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {3562, 3563, 3564, 3953}
Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {MID2004, MID2006, MID2105}

description: This practice unit complements the theory unit Childbearing obstacles and will focus on students developing their knowledge and skills relating to the obstacles women may experience during pregnancy, labour and birth and the first weeks after birth. Emphasis is given to the recognition of problems and the collaborative and referral role of the midwife. Whilst recognising the role of other healthcare practitioners, midwifery care will be central. Students will be introduced to the use of medical technology and obstetrical intervention whilst maintaining a woman-centred focus.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
